Description: One corner of a plain weave, undyed cotton cloth, probably from a garment, with an elaborate fringe and one reinforced selvedge; Fringe consists of three rows of plaited, plied warp threads; 8mm where the warp threads divide in groups are wrapped by another thread (groups divided and reformed to make, in depth, one complete lozenge and two half lozenge); two rows of plaited warp; a row of tassels, each consisting of a bundle of additional threads bound at the top, folded over a knotted loop of main warp threads; Warp: S-spun, c.11 tpc; Weft: S-spun, c.9tpc; Edges: selvedge of 3 cords, with extra picks of main weft, fringe, other edges ragged
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
